bill_title: revise certain provisions concerning sales receipts maintained by temporary vendors.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions concerning sales receipts maintained by temporary vendors. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-45-86 be amended to read: 10-45-86. A temporary vendor shall maintain daily sales receipts, such as cash register tapes, hand written receipts, credit card receipts, or other receipts,. Each receipt shall be sequentially numbered with a duplicate copy recorded during or immediately after completion of each transaction. The duplicate copy may be in the form of a cash register tape, electronic software program report, written or printed credit card receipt, or hand-written sales receipt. The receipt shall identify the item sold, the sale price, the tax charged, and the time and date of the transaction. The vendor shall maintain the receipts for a minimum of three years. The vendor shall provide such the receipts for immediate inspection and review to any agent or representative of the Department of Revenue or any law enforcement officer upon request. Failure to comply with this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.161 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
